reviewText: Personally, I bought this because of the setlist. Some of the songs here were little played throughout the band's career, like Deep in the Motherlode, One for the Vine, Duke's Travel/Duke's End, Duchess and The Lady Lies. The reason for that is the year: in 1980, they were promoting mainly the latest album (Duke) and a bit of the three previous (And Then There Were Three, Wind & Wuthering and A Trick of the Tail). All the other songs are also great, but they can be found elsewhere (except for Say It's Alright, Joe, which I wouldn't have included in the setlist). I won't grant it 5 stars because of the image & sound quality, which is subpar.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I hesitated to buy this dvd, because of no reviews, and almost no description. It has a reasonable price, so I decided to take a chance. I was not disappointed. This is a great concert recorded October 25, 2007 at London's Roundhouse, a few months after the release of MEMORY ALMOST FULL and broadcast on BBC. McCartney is in a great mood, chatting and joking, between songs, with the sold-out audience. Many members of the audience have handmade signs, some of which McCartney reads, and everyone is having a lot of fun. It must have been great to see McCartney in this relatively small venue.McCartney plays bass, guitar, piano and mandolin. His voice shows it's age at times but he still sounds great.  The band members are the same as on the album. Paul Wickens on keyboards, accordion and percussion, Rusty Anderson on guitar, Brian Ray on guitar and bass, and Abe Laboriel on drums.They perform songs from throughout McCartney's solo career and 12 of the 24 are Beatles songs. One of the highlights is an acoustic version of The Beatles' "I'll Follow The Sun". Paul does solo, with acoustic guitar versions of "Here Today" and "Blackbird". They do acoustic versions, with an eight piece string ensemble, of "Calico Skies" and "Eleanore Rigby". The strings also perform on the rockin' "Only Mama knows"This is not an official McCartney release, and it was manufactured in Argentina, but the audio and video are excellent. A BBC Films + DVD logo is on the top left of the screen throughout the 90 minute concert. There are no special features or menu. The only information is the set list on the back of the dvd case. The dvd begins playing when inserted, which I don't mind. I have several McCartney dvd concerts, and this is one of the best.set list;Magical Mystery TourFlaming PieGot To Get You Into My LifeDance TonightOnly Mama KnowsC MoonThe Long And Winding RoadI'll Follow The SunThat Was MeHere TodayBlackbirdCalico SkiesEleanor RigbyBand On The RunBack In The U.S.S.R.House Of WaxI've Got A FeelingLive And Let DieBaby Face/Hey JudeLet It BeLady MadonnaI Saw Her Standing ThereGet Back

reviewText: Upon receiving this it was swiftly apparent that it is a bootleg. And not a good one. Homemade menus, one audio track. At least the song titles are spelled properly!The video on this DVD is very bad YouTube quality at best. It is literally the worst looking thing I've ever seen on DVD.The audio is okay. Not great, but okay. If you want to experience this concert look online for good audio versions of the show.The video appears to have been professionally recorded (back in 1980 when production values weren't as they are today). It's not some guy in the audience with one video cam or super8. The video is sort of nice to see, but it's so blurry and so pixelated you'll just be frustrated.If I'd paid more than $10 I'd return it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoy anything Beatles related and saw Paul with Wings in Foxboro, Mass and in Hartford with a newer lineup after 2001 in Hartford. I love Rockshow and all Pauls other shows. I recently saw this concert on Palladia TV and don't recall seeing the LOGO  in the top left of the screen. When I watch a movie or a concert , I like to lose myself in the moment; and picture myself in the audience enjoying every minute. However the continuous LOGO spoils it for me. The music is great. Too bad.. Try Halifax, Nova Scotia 2009.
